meanings.definition: A device that collects and measures airborne particles.
meanings.sent1: The aerophores in the lab helped scientists study the air.
meanings.sent2: The aerophores detected high levels of pollution in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The aerophores at the weather station were always busy counting particles.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an aerophore, constantly gathering information from her surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The aerophores hummed softly as they analyzed the air quality.

meanings.definition: Organisms that can survive in the air.
meanings.sent1: Birds are considered aerophores because they spend most of their time flying.
meanings.sent2: Some insects have adapted to become aerophores, living high above the ground.
meanings.sent3: The aerophores of the insect world enjoy the freedom of the skies.
meanings.sent4: His spirit soared like an aerophore, untethered and free.
meanings.sent5: The aerophores of the bird kingdom navigate the winds with grace.
